answers.author: Alexandra Iannolo
answers.text:
Hello,
I found some resources that may be helpful in answering your question.
San Antonio hosts a large Arts Night, which could not go on without the support of corporate donors.
http://icma.org/en/icma/knowledge_network/documents/kn/Document/302412/2010_ICMA_Community_Partnership_Award_Nominee_Luminaria__Arts_Night_in_San_Antonio
This document discusses the sponsorship system the City of El Centro, CA uses to help fund their festivals.
http://icma.org/en/icma/knowledge_network/documents/kn/Document/14781
I also included a blog about festival tourism that discusses a couple of cities, which host different events each year.
http://icma.org/en/icma/knowledge_network/blogs/blogpost/313/Festival_Tourism 
Bethel, Ohio is hosting an Arts and Music Festival in May. You may want to contact them directly for more information about their process.
http://www.bethelohevents.com/
Ali Iannolo
Knowledge Network Intern
aiannolo@ICMA.org

author: Andrew Greenblatt
text:
I'm looking to plan a music and arts festival that will take place on a Saturday in August. The city I work in has en extremely tight budget and this festival needs to be cash positive. 
I hope to recruit sponsors and book big bands. Any knowledge and experience in this area is much appreciated as I begin this journey.
title: One Day Music and Arts Festival
